Mini1326: Mansion Mafia

Everyone had been invited to see the art show in the famous mansion of Versailles. It was an exciting event, one many had been anticipating to attend all year. And finally the time had come. But of course, things were never as wonderful as the guests had hoped for. The mansion was located on a deserted island only accessible by ferry. Upon arrival, they noted how omnious the whole area was. Many were shocked at their surroundings, their extravagent expectations shattered within mere seconds. Murmurs of discomfort quikcly spread. "It'll be okay guys. Come on now, I'm sure it's better once we're inside.." One of them commented nervously, trying to qwell the tension, though the uncertainty within her own voice was quite apparent. The group looked behind them, watching as the ferry quickly disappeared into the horizon. They had no where to go but in.

I LIVEEEEEE!!

General
1. This is a game. Play nice and be respectful. Most importanty, have fun!
2. Do not discuss this game outside of this thread. On this site or off, we adopt a strict Vegas policy aka what goes on here, stays here.
3. Do not quote any PMs that I send to you. Doing so will get you mod killed.
4. There is to be no editing of posts.
5. Do not use any language other than English or any type of hidden, invisible or hard to read font.

Voting
1. All votes must be in bold like so: Vote: You. Votes that are not bolded will not be counted.
2. Similarly, you may unvote by typing Unvote: You. Unvoting before a Vote is not required but those who do so will get cookies.
3. You may choose to Vote: No Lynch if you do not wish to lynch anyone that day.
4. A successful lynch requires a majority of votes (half the number of living players + 1). Once majority is reached, all other vote changes will be disregarded. Players (even the one who was lynched) may talk during Twilight.
5. If you are dead, you are dead. But since I am nice I will let you become a zombie and have one non-game related "Bah!" post.
6. If no majority is reached by deadline, no lynch will occur.

Activity & Deadlines
1. I will stick by a (7 + # of living players) policy for days. Nights will always be 72 hours. All deadlines are in Pacific Time.
2. Deadline extensions will only be given in extreme cases at the mod's disgression.
3. Players who do not post for 72 hours will receive a prod. After two unsuccessful prods I will replace you.
4. If your lack of activity becomes a constant problem throughout the game, I will replace you. You may proceed to complain to me afterwards and in return I will proceed to ignore you.
5. If you know you will be absent for more than two days, please use V/LA to let me know.

Mod Rules
1. Breaking a rule will result in a warning. Break another rule and I will mod kill you in the most painful way possible.
2. In the chance that I make a mistake please let me know asap so I can correct it!
3. Dark red is my color. Use it and I cannot garuntee your safety =O.
5. If you need my attention, bold it. Mod: Hail the almighty Chau
6. Feel free to ask questions for clarification or anything else via Mod: tag or PM. I will do my best to answer promptly and whatnot.
*Remember that as mod I have final say on all matters. That being said..HAVE FUN!

Sample Role PM:
You are a Vanilla Townie. You have no special abilities other than the ability to vote during the day.

You win when all threats to the town are eliminated.

Please pm me your role as confirmation


Game will begin when 10/12 confirm.

Role PMs sent out. You may talk during confirmation phase.
/egosearch

10/12 confirmed.

After getting settled in their rooms, the group started to feel a little more at ease. It would be a nice little vacation, they told themselves. That is, until they heard the scream. Running towards the source of the noise, the group came across the bloody body of the woman who had spoken to them earlier, a single knife lodged into the center of her back. Each guest looked around nervously. Rumors of mafia hits had been all over the news lately. These mysterious individuals had managed to infiltrate a variety of groups and always left a trail of blood behind them. The engraved knife being their signature mark.

And now, trapped on a deserted island meant only one thing. The mafia was not only here but was hidden amongst the guests. And so it began.

No. Don't fight how the game is played. There are limited paths of fighting RVS.

RVS -> Bandwagoning -> Discussion -> No more RVS
RVS -> Some crazy fuck up -> Discussion -> No more RVS

It appears Senjai has lead us down Path #2, you should send him a thank you card.

Really, I don't see the purpose of saying "I vote someone because Vote:X sounds good."

Random questions seem a lot more useful since they actually make people think about things and talk logically and reasonably, it breeds more useful discussion and it creates more room for slip-ups.

I think that while a Lynch can give information, if you lynch for the sake of lynching it is nothing more than a shot in the dark. Whether the shot in the dark hits an adequate target really just promotes hindsight in the late game. You can hit a mafia member and use all of his posts to draw some sort of indication of his mafia heritage and apply that to new suspects as they may be colluding feeling like this random hit was actually more indicative than anything other than a random hit. Or you can hit a townie and lose someone for no reason whatsoever.

By sticking myself out like this with a proposed no lynch I've apparently made myself a target. I think the people who are more suspicious are the ones who wait to post and analyze the argument and either bandwagon or post irrelevant material. Given that this game is so fresh we've not had the time to commit people to being lurkers or bandwagoners. I don't think a lynch in day 1 would offer any great value, much akin to throwing a dart at a dartboard blindfolded.

tl;dr - I'd like to wait and see what some of the less active posters do before i start my guessing game, you don't have to follow me, it's just simply my opinion.

Before I even read your post, I'm going to say this:

Day 1 is a lengthy process. We don't lynch right away. We lets reads happen. That is why Day 1 is generally given a more generous deadline by the mod than other days.

Plain and simple, the goal of the game is to kill the mafia, swiftly is preferable. The town's biggest tool, and possibly only tool, to do so is the lynch.

Lynching after getting reads D1 - Chances of a mafia being dead by Day 2 = Probably 20-33% depending on the number of players and quality of players
Lynching instantaneously D1 - Changes of a mafia being dead by Day 2 = 10-20% depending on the number of players
NLing after getting reads D1 - Chances of a mafia being dead by Day 2 = 0% (barring any weird roles, PGO, or multiple mafia teams)
NLing instantaneously D1 - Chances of a mafia being dead by Day 2 = 0% + You're an idiot

I'll be the first to admit that I'm an impatient and hyper-aggressive player. I think of mafia like a game of chess, except that the mafia have a quick advantage, due to the fact that they have information that the town doesn't right from the get go, and can coordinate actions. Hence, they essentially get an additional rook and queen. One of the most important parts of the opening game of chess is to take control of the middle of the board- be aggressive, and push pieces forward. I argue that the same applies with Mafia.

In order to counter the coordination of the mafia, the town must do two things- throw the mafia off balance, and get information about the other players. One of the best ways to do this is via an early wagon- through pushing players and putting pressure on them, you're more likely to be able to both get the mafia to slip up, and generate better reads. The more accurate a read on a player is, the more information the town accumulates.

For instance, the pressure I am currently placing makes me think that you are likely town- you're sticking to your guns, and provided solid reads on the rest of the players in your previous post.

Hence, I am against playing passively in the early game- if the game is taken too slowly, then the mafia have more time to both coordinate their movements and figure out ways to force stagnation. It also allows them to be more prepared for pressure, and thus can make it harder to generate solid reads. I believe more than anything that this is merely a playstyle difference.

Let me make this clear: An early lynch is anti-town, and anybody encouraging it should be scrutinized heavily. An early bandwagon is pro-town.

Glad to see DCL, and can't wait for the promised content. I'm glad to see I was wrong re: Jackal- I'll be glad to see future content. I'll respond to Senjai's post at a future date- this post is long enough as it is. (I hope I covered the other post I skipped in my response to Political, Senjai. If you have any more comments in regards to my Jackal suspicion that you feel I missed, feel free to bring them up).

Heh, not a problem. Happens to everybody at one point or another. ^^.

And to trim down the wagon post, because it definitely is TL;DR-

Spoiler: Early Wagon Analysis
Essentially, in my opinion, the actions on certain players don't make sense regarding the Political wagon. Hiraki, Junpei, and I vote for Political, with Cry voting later. Soras states that one of PC/Hiraki is scum, but that he doesn't feel comfortable voting with the information he has.

Then I push for Gooner to join the wagon- he agrees that political is scummy, but says that there isn't enough there to get him to vote. I find this odd, given the fact that it would merely put Political at L-3 with no real risk for a lynch to be reached and continue to pressure, and he says that there isn't anything solid enough.

Pecan comes along with similar reasoning- they agree that Political is scummy, but that DCL is scummier, but don't vote. I ask why this is, and pecan states that there's no need for me to worry about "pushing votes down" because the PC wagon isn't moving. This is something I find slightly odd. After all, pecan would be voting for DCL if they voted, so why would he comment about the traction of the PC wagon? Not a big deal, just bugs me a bit.

Then, Shotgun comes along and puts PC at L-2. A wagon instantly forms. Shotgun notes PC's 4 contentless posts, his L-2 vote, and votes him as a result. Fair enough. Then pecan jumps on, without giving any reasoning beyond a vague "Don't like those posts". Earlier he stated that there was no need to worry about voting or starting a wagon, and now he's quickly building momentum for a shotgun wagon based on a handful of posts, without providing any reasoning?

Gooner then jumps on with the same reasoning as the other two. He does argue later that shotgun was scummier, but I don't quite get his reasons why PC wasn't worth a vote, if shotgun was. He argues that scum "go into the background", and are "calculating" but isn't coming in and immediately putting a player at L-2 drawing attention to yourself, and extremely reckless? And if he wasn't really advancing the discussion, wasn't he really "in the background"?

This is then followed by Political's vote. Simply the shady nature of this wagon and how hard it was to get one to form on Political make me really think that it's a scum-motivated counterwagon. The Goonerwagon doesn't look much better.


I hope this post was somewhat easier to digest.

The bold is for the leading bandwagon. Which would be the first bandwagon that had the leading votes. Ex: If person A and person B were both tied at 3 votes, but A was at 3 votes before B, then A would be bolded. This is because for lynches, it is the first one to seven votes that goes through. In General
The most important thing to remember about social graces on this site is that most scummers are longtime Netizens and (superficially) mature adults. We're fairly welcoming people, but if you post like a fourteen-year-old Net Newbie, you will likely be treated as such.

Scummers represent a wide variety of backgrounds, interests, religions, and orientations. Politically speaking the board is fairly liberal for the most part. If you are uncomfortable with another user or a topic of discussion, you are advised to politely avoid them.
In Mafia Games
Mafia is not a "comfortable" game, and for this reason it's not for everyone. Your honesty, reputation, skill level, and intelligence will likely all be questioned and/or insulted by people who may not have your best interest in mind. 2) Majiffy is town.
3) PC is potentially scum, but attacked both DLC and Gooner during day 1's PB wagon.

I'm trying to make sense of all this, but so far I'm thinking DLC is the most likely scum in the core 3. PC's last vote switch during day 1 looks like they could potentially be connected as well. Unvote, vote DLC.

1. There is a strong connection between DCL(me), Hiraki, and Gooner.
2. One of the three in our group is scum.
3. Hiraki and Gooner are town.

1. I agree that there is a strong connection between Hiraki and Gooner. There is not a similar connection between me and either of those two. True, but jacks-of-all-trades can be balanced in a Mini and haven't been uncommon. Just from December 2010 (when normalcy reviews became mandatory) to approximately November 2011, 1 game utilized a mafia jack-of-all-trades and 5 games utilized a town jack-of-all-trades. All 6 were 12- or 13-player games. For the games for which I had the information, the powers for the town jacks-of-all-trades varied as follows:

  • Investigate, kill, roleblock
  • Gunsmith, roleblock, track
  • Investigate, kill, protect, roleblock
  • Investigate, kill, track
Basically, what Gooner claimed isn't far-fetched balance-wise. I'm inclined to believe him right now because Gooner-scum would know just how powerful a claim he's just made.
